message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product! I think it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $150.
Thank you for the offer, Alice.  I appreciate you thinking it's worth that much to me, but I'm really only looking to spend up to $80.  Would you be willing to consider that?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand you're looking to spend $80, but I'm not willing to go that low. I'm willing to meet you in the middle and offer you the product for $110. It's a fair price considering its value to you.

Alice, I appreciate you meeting me halfway, but $110 is still a bit out of my budget.  I'm firm on my offer of $80, and I'm happy to continue negotiating, but if we can't reach an agreement, I'll have to go with John's offer.

I understand your budget constraints, Bob, and I'm willing to make a slight adjustment. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $100. It's a compromise, but I think it's still a good value for you.
Alice, I appreciate you trying to work with me.  I'm still really only looking to spend $80.  I'm happy to keep negotiating, but if we can't reach an agreement, I'll need to go with John's offer.

I understand you're really trying to stick to your budget, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll sell the product to you for $95. It's my lowest offer, and I think it's still a great value for you.
Alice, thanks again for your offer, but I'm still really only looking to spend $80.  This is my final offer.  If we can't make this work, I'll need to go with John's deal.
